title: Citigroup Profit Jumps 48% After Releasing Rainy-Day Funds
sub_head: Bank beats analyst expectations for third quarter
body:
Citigroup Inc. said Thursday its third-quarter profit rose 48%, after the bank released some of the money it had set aside for bad loans early in the pandemic.
The bank reported a profit of $4.64 billion, or $2.15 per share, up from $3.15 billion, or $1.36 a share, a year earlier. That beat the $1.71 per share that analysts had expected, according to FactSet.
